query:
I need to fact-check a citation. This is the citation from the bibliography:

Greetham, David. "Uncoupled: OR, How I Lost My Author(s)." Textual Cultures: Texts, Contexts, Interpretation, vol. 3 no. 1, 2008, p. 45-46. Project MUSE, doi:10.2979/tex.2008.3.1.44.

And this is the in-line citation:

Our relationship with the authors of the works we read can often be “obscured not by a "cloak of print" but by the veil of scribal confusion and mis-transmission” (Greetham 45-46).

Does the quoted text match what is actually in the article? If Yes, answer Yes, otherwise, give me the word in my citation that does not match with the correct one (without any article).

follow_up_queries: Retrieve the text from pages 45-46 of the article 'Uncoupled: OR, How I Lost My Author(s)' by David Greetham for comparison.

tasks.description: найти статью Greetham, David. 'Uncoupled: OR, How I Lost My Author(s).' на Project MUSE

result.query: найти статью Greetham, David. 'Uncoupled: OR, How I Lost My Author(s).' на Project MUSE

facts.fact: The article 'Uncoupled: OR, How I Lost My Author(s)' by David Greetham is published in 'Textual Cultures: Texts, Contexts, Interpretation'.
The article spans pages 44-55 in the journal.
The DOI for the article is 10.2979/tex.2008.3.1.44.
David Greetham is affiliated with the Graduate Center of the City University of New York.

sources.title: smolagents/gaia-traces · Datasets at Hugging Face
sources.snippet:
(once acquired) and the in-line citation to determine if they match verbatim.

## 2. Plan
1. Call the `search\_agent` with the task to locate and access the article “Uncoupled: OR, How I Lost My Author(s)” by David Greetham on Project MUSE using the DOI: 10.2979/tex.2008.3.1.44. The agent should confirm that the article exists and provide the text, or a method to obtain the text, from pages 45-46.
2. Once the article content for pages 45-46 is available, compare the provided in-line citation, “obscured not by a 'cloak of print' but by the veil of scribal confusion and mis-transmission,” wi
